google_play_reviews.replyContent: The latest version (1.6 released a few days ago) fixes some issues with group code. Also make sure you set the same code in the settings of all your devices and restart the app afterwards.

google_play_reviews.content: Can't seem to get jpg files to transfer properly so that they can be opened on the receiving computer. Update.. VPN will cause problems with file transfers on android. Simply turn it off. Works perfect!

Used to be great but now they have added an option for security and if you dont accept it then you lose flexibility. I have no issue with added security for those that needed it but not giving the ability to opt out without neutering the program means I am now looking for another simple file transfer program. Take something simple that works and then add complexity and lose the original benefit
Very convenient
Works very well, thanks a lot!
I am a little.....much ignorant about how to set up the firewall so I will probably leave it in unsafe mode for now. Works as fast as your router does :).

For the first few months I didn't have 100% success getting the app to see my Linux computer or vice versa, but in the last couple months it seems to work all the time. As soon as the app is open on both devices, they see each other and I can easily transfer (copy) pictures and videos from the phone to the computer. I just long-press the file I want to share, tap the share icon, and choose Warpinator from the list. Haven't tried sending files from the computer to the phone, nor other file types.
Amazing Experience, sent files from Android to My steam deck works flowlessly
Excellent app for file sharing

This is a BRILLIANT transfer tool. Transferring files from one device to another was never easier or faster. And all it takes is for this app to be installed on both devices and for those devices to be in the same network. Holding the floating send button even allows the transfer of entire folders. AMAZING!!! Developer response time is also excellent. Good work!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes, by long pressing the send (up arrow) floating button. I should probably add some hint to the UI to show this is possible.

google_play_reviews.content: This is a great app, and it has a cool name üòé
Great for all my needs on linux as thats all I run

litteraly used it for a single png image so far, but it was so fast and simple that a 5 star had to be given before I forgot to give a review completely. If I find any issues, I'll update the review, but for now - good job :)
Does not see other computers
Sharing between Linux Mint (and other Ubuntu distributions) or Windows (both forks) does not work (with and without default room code) Edit/response: Not due to a crash.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Could you tell us what exactly doesn't work, ideally via email or a GitHub issue? We'd like to fix it if the problem is on our side. If it is a connection issue, please see the Connection issues document from the menu and if nothing helps, follow the instructions at the end to obtain a debug log and attach it to the email or issue. Thank you.

google_play_reviews.content: Works perfectly with my steam deck!
(works for windows 11 too) finally this does the job of file transfer from android to pc over wifi at highest possible constant speed.
i love you
I can surely say this *The best App of it's kind* I have ever experienced. Another best thing about it is... It's free ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞

Good app and seems to work well with single files but how do I copy multiple files or a folder. I can use the 'select all' option of the file manager that opens but then there's no way to send. When I try and select a folder, it opens the folder instead of choosing it for transfer. I'd give it 5 stars otherwise.
Even easier to use than the desktop app.
works butter smooth
I'm unable to find sending folder option like windows version has.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Since version 1.5 it is now possible to send a folder by long pressing the Send (up arrow) floating button.

Clean app, worked perfectly fine with my desktop.
Occasional connection issues, but not enough to drop a star üåü. Installed on two Android tablets, plus the original on Linux Mint. Brilliant work by the FOSS developer.
The issues I was having seem to have resolved themselves. The app is working well now.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Other group codes work for me. Just restart the app after changing it to make sure it is applied. Obviously the codes on both devices must match.

The easiest file share program you can get for Linux users (there's a port for windows but I've never tried it)

Very nice app. I installed it 5 mins ago, and my first transfers are already complete. In my experience, this almost never happens so easily. Xfers done between mint 20.3 and s20fe

Amazing, works perfect with mint 20.3 and galaxy s21. At last an app that does what it says it does. To all of 10 seconds to set up, simply launch warpinator on your pc &phone and your ready to go. 100% awesome. Thanks dev team, excellent work!

Perfect 100% - I use this app over on Linux Mint as well computer networking made easy... and I'm a computer technician :-)

Works great.I also use this software on my Linux Mint desktop and laptop to transfer files. I also use it for my file server as well.
Perfectly working! Love it ‚ò∫
Nice! Works as expected. P. S. If you're experiencing a connection issue, try to update firewall rules on desktop warpinator in connection settings
Works just as it should on Linux Mint 20.2: an excellent addition to my systems.

Doesn't work on Android 12. Fails to even start. Used to work fine. Update: the fix is effective and this app works again, I am happy to say. Update: doesn't work with Mint 20.3. It connected this time, but couldn't send any data from phone to Linux box, although I did accept the permission request. The Linux box firewall is turned off. Update: Now it works. A couple of restarts of the app and the Linux box, and a phone restart may have done it. Thanks for your help slowscript.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Does it say any errors on either side? On Android you can tap on a failed transfer to see what (probably) went wrong. If that doesn't tell you much then we'll need a debug log as described on the "connection issues" page. It would also be better to continue this via an issue on GitHub or email.

google_play_reviews.content: File over than 2gb can not be sent Edit : nice work after updating, thanks it's useful app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This should be fixed in version 1.4.4. Please give it a try.

Thanks for the wonderful app.
Now its very easy to transfer files b/w android device and Linux! Great application!

This works great for transfering files from different Android/Linux devices. It's fast and easy to use. Much more convenient than hunting for a thumb drive or a cable. I know I have issues finding something when I'm in a hurry. LoL I highly recommend this app for quick and easy Linux based file transfers.
This app works really well. I transfer files from my Linux desktop to my android phone and vise versa with no problems.
Great application for sending files to Linux laptop. Connection and sending are fast and good.

the star button click did nothing was using it in dark mode by default it caught system theme and respected that, that is nice, no option to clear history was a missing part. so 4 stars but yes worked flawless and does what it says. good one.
Overall good but the star button doesn't work in the app, and files gets resend automatically when a new file is send after sending one previously!
Easy and fast way to exchange files among Warpinator compatible devices on the same network. Nice slim app without unnecessary clutter. Simply does the job.
Excellent app
Best app for easy transfer of files to your linux desktop.
Great app with easy to use interface. Just remember to add 42000 IN on both UDP and TCP in the firewall. Works seamlessly with Linux Mint 20.2. Thanks for your time and energy into making this!
Wow, it works perfectly! For the first time I am able to transfer files effortlessly between my Linux Mint laptop and Android phone.
Didn't work on mint 20.1 and android 12

nice
Installed and working as advertised out of the box. No setup required...
What a wonderful app. Just works.

Works perfectly with Linux mint 20.2. Not necessary to configure firewall with this new version. Warpinator is included as part of the normal install for Linux mint 20.2., all that is needed is to download the app for Android and it just works. Bob

Works perfectly on Linux mint 20.2. As everyone said, we need to enable incoming/outgoing traffic in firewall to make this work. Also the 'network interface'(in desktop) to use option under preferences-> Connection should be changed to the one shown at right corner while we opened the application
Works
Awesome!! It's blazing fastüî•üî•thanks devsü•≥

Works like a charm now.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I think this should be fixed in v1.2.1. Please give it a try.

google_play_reviews.content: i use arch btw
Simple and Fast File Transfer - a breeze to use
Now I don't have to use a USB cable. Nice!
Warpinator is a very useful application, but it is still very unreliable.

Blooming marvelous app thank you. This app works on Linux Mint 20.2. Delete the ucf firewall settings it auto generates and 'allow' using ucf firewall 'simple rules' 'both' TCP and UDP for both ports 42000 and 42001. My Android mobile and tablet and Linux desktop and laptop can now all talk to each other. Thank you kind developer it is very much appreciated.

Works fine once the firewall settings are configured. Most of the negative reviews are those who never tweaked their firewall settings with the given port. Tested it on Linux Mint XFCE, MATE & Cinnamon respectively. It's simple and works great on most of the Desktop Environments.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review. The Mint devs have recently fixed the firewall settings compatibility and soon adding the extra exception manually will no longer be necessary.

google_play_reviews.content: Works seamlessly with both Linux Mint and Arch Linux
Works well with Linuxmint. Clearing the app when finished needs work. Android file manager not as easy as Linux
Works like a charm if you are able to open port 42000 on the linux system.
Good
Useless. The pc is forever waiting for a two-way connection. As a Linux user, I have no choice but remaining proud that my operating system still has complete and utter connectile dysfunction.
Running on two android phones. Both cannot recieve certificates from LAN Linux computers. (and the two phones cannot connect) The Linux computers have no problem send /receive files with Warpinator.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Do you have your firewall on your PC configured properly? We use a little older authentication method that needs to have UDP transfer on port 42000 enabled and newer versions of Linux Warpinator no longer add the exception.

google_play_reviews.content: i love it
Most of the time don't work
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hello Monica, what exactly doesn't work? If you could describe your problem in an email or a GitHub issue we would be happy to help. Also make sure you have the latest version. Many bugs have been fixed recently.

google_play_reviews.content: Very good app
Works good, thank you developers! Took me a bit to get the hang of it but then I'm not the fastest slug in the forest. Just be sure to set the firewall rules (from settings - very handy).
Works like a charm (Pixel 4a + ThinkPad X250 running LM 20.2).

I could see my computer (mint 20.2) listed within the app on phobe, but they were never able to connect. The debug log on the phone says it couldn't get the certificate. Not sure where the problem lies.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks for providing more information than "it doesn't work". Your review led me to discover that the Linux version has a new way of authentication and no longer adds a necessary firewall exception. Please try updating your firewall to have an exception not only for TCP but also UDP on port 42000. This should solve the issue in most cases.

google_play_reviews.content: I have the latest warpinator and LM 19.2. LM, using Warp's firewall adjustments, cannot see this app, but the app can see the desktop instance.

Amazing! Thank you so much for the Android app, works great as expected!!

feature requests: 1) option to stop warpinator service if device is not connected to lan, (may be optional timeout too). manually stopping service to save battery is annoying 2) ability to share text (not only files, e.g. links/notes from phone browser). love the app, easy and clean! thank you
Must have app for those who use Linux Mint. I'd like to see move operation as well.

Updated 2023: I quit trying to use this thing. It's great idea but simply waste of time trying to get it to connect reliably. I wish it works better and maybe I try it again in the future. Regardless, thank you for the hard work of developers and Linux Mint team. Old post: Great! Some minor issues connecting at times but usually simple and fast. My router is getting old, causing a variety of issues, so I blame that.

Works perfectly! My phone has a finicky port so it's hard to transfer large files from my laptop through a cable, but this app is a lifesaver. It's fast, simple, and the UI is pretty to boot. No ads to be found, just pure function.
Excellent app. Pairing is seamless, fast and intuitive, and works better than some paid alternatives.
Works fine with my Pixel 3. Flawless file transfer. Awesome work, dev.
Fastest file transfers over wifi I've ever seen. I'd give it 10 stars if I could.
Linux Mint user here. This will make all the difference when it comes to moving files.

Just now downloaded. Copied a couple of files both ways, from my Motorola Fusion Plus to my HP Envy notebook running Linux Mint 20.1 Ulysses. Works like a charm. Will update later after using it more. Great job, Slowscript üëç
It just works. Great app. I hope it gets accepted as official.
Best app. But cant send large file in my phone

Version 1.2 didn't work for me, but after installing 1.2.1 and restarting Android all is working smoothly. There are still a few rough edges, such as in Settings you can enable writing to a debug log file but there's no indication of where that file is or how to access it. But only minor wrinkles so far. And this beats the heck out of transferring via USB cable or FTP.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: If it doesn't want to connect, you can force it to retry by tapping the button next to the status icon. If that doesn't help, version 1.2.1 also allows you to enable exporting logs to a file (in the settings). I would appreciate if you could send us the log via email or issue on GitHub.

google_play_reviews.content: Love it, I liked to select multiple files and send them. Keep on the great work. Thx
Quick and easy. I installed on Ubuntu and was immediately able to send files. The transfer speed is excellent. Given the problems linking Android to Linux, this is a really brilliant app.
Odd, won't work for me. Warp on phone see my laptop and desktop but the connection fails. Works well between my laptop and desktop. Hope there is a fix since i've liked using it on my comps.
This is much awaited app. Thank you

Tried it with my Linux Mint 20.1 Cinnamon laptop over the weekend, connected straightaway and was flawless in transferring the files. On the app, I can't see a way to remove the history of the files that I've transferred, I'd like to do this to keep a clean screen whilst transferring new files. You can remove them on the desktop app. Overall though it's an excellent app and means I don't have to find my USB lead and connect my phone to my laptop.
Works as described just the speed isn't at par when compared to other wifi file transfer apps available out there.
Simple and fastest solution to transfer files. Great work!
Doesn't work. Well, doesn't work for me, anyway. Installed on Note 9 and Chromebook, will see each other, but always gives error 'connection failed', hence the rating.
Yesssss! Knocks spots off trying to transfer via Bluetooth... works well with my computer running Linux Mint v 20. Thank you ...no more messing around e nailing files to myself !!!

it works very well with my LMDE4.
Fantastic, thank you so much for this, works flawlessly for me.
It feels a little slow for me. Only 1.5 mbps when transferring a file. Anyway thanks for bringing this to android.

Works well, a very clean and simple layout. If you're having trouble connecting to your desktop you'll want to open whatever port you're using to communicate (default is 42000) on your desktops firewall. A simple message noting this when a failed connection occurs would probably be pretty useful. Other than that I have no complaints.
Amazing!!! Warpinator made by linux mint is best than kde connect!!! I am very happy thank much. Goodbye kde and kde connect

Wonderful, Brilliant love you guys. How flipping easy is it, Linux Mint 20.1 spotted my Galaxy S8, as did the S8 see my phone. Works great and fast!
